# GraphQL Schema Generator

## Overview
Generate GraphQL schemas, types, and resolvers.

## Activation
Activates when user mentions "graphql", "schema.graphql", "resolver", or "mutation".

## Instructions

1. Design schema with:
   - Types and inputs
   - Queries and mutations
   - Subscriptions
   - Custom scalars

2. Generate resolvers

## Examples

**Schema:**
```graphql
type User {
  id: ID!
  email: String!
  name: String
  posts: [Post!]!
  createdAt: DateTime!
}

type Post {
  id: ID!
  title: String!
  content: String!
  author: User!
  published: Boolean!
  createdAt: DateTime!
}

input CreatePostInput {
  title: String!
  content: String!
  published: Boolean = false
}

type Query {
  user(id: ID!): User
  users(limit: Int = 10, offset: Int = 0): [User!]!
  post(id: ID!): Post
  posts(published: Boolean): [Post!]!
}

type Mutation {
  createPost(input: CreatePostInput!): Post!
  updatePost(id: ID!, input: CreatePostInput!): Post!
  deletePost(id: ID!): Boolean!
}
```

**Resolvers:**
```javascript
const resolvers = {
  Query: {
    user: (_, { id }) => db.user.findUnique({ where: { id } }),
    posts: (_, { published }) => 
      db.post.findMany({ where: published != null ? { published } : {} })
  },
  Mutation: {
    createPost: (_, { input }, ctx) => 
      db.post.create({ data: { ...input, authorId: ctx.userId } })
  },
  User: {
    posts: (user) => db.post.findMany({ where: { authorId: user.id } })
  }
};
```
